intro: Oreocarya mensana, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada lily, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and showy white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, high-altitude environments, such as meadows and slopes. It has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery coating. Oreocarya mensana plays an important ecological role in its habitat by providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of alpine ecosystems.
